museums.description: A museum dedicated to India’s first Prime Minister, showcasing his life and contributions to the nation.

museums.description: A museum dedicated to the soldiers who served in India’s various wars and conflicts, showcasing uniforms and weapons.

museums.description: A museum dedicated to the life and legacy of India’s first Deputy Prime Minister, showcasing his contributions.

museums.description: A museum dedicated to Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, showcasing his life, teachings, and efforts towards social justice.

museums.description: A museum dedicated to India’s agricultural history, with exhibits on farming tools, crop cultivation, and rural traditions.

museums.description: A science museum focusing on various fields of science with hands-on displays, exhibits, and educational content.

museums.name: Planetarium Museum
museums.description: A museum featuring exhibits on astronomy and space science, including models of planets and celestial objects.

monuments.name: Qutub Minar
monuments.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, the Qutub Minar is a tower built in the 12th century.

monuments.name: Red Fort
monuments.description: A symbol of India's rich history, the Red Fort is a 17th-century fortification built by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan.
monuments.location: Netaji Subhash Marg, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi

monuments.name: India Gate
monuments.description: A war memorial to soldiers who died during World War I, it stands at the center of New Delhi.

monuments.name: Humayun's Tomb
monuments.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, Humayun's Tomb is a stunning example of Mughal architecture and the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun.

monuments.name: Lotus Temple
monuments.description: A Bahá'í House of Worship, known for its unique lotus flower-like structure, open to all religions.

monuments.name: Jantar Mantar
monuments.description: An astronomical observatory built in the 18th century, it features large instruments used to observe celestial bodies.
monuments.location: Sansad Marg, Connaught Place, New Delhi

monuments.name: Bangla Sahib Gurudwara
monuments.description: A prominent Sikh Gurudwara, dedicated to the eighth Sikh Guru, Guru Har Krishan.

monuments.name: Safdarjung Tomb
monuments.description: A Mughal-style tomb built in the 18th century, it is the tomb of Safdarjung, a noble in the Mughal Empire.

monuments.name: Purana Qila
monuments.description: One of the oldest forts in Delhi, dating back to the Mughal period, and associated with the legend of the Mahabharata.

monuments.name: Tughlaqabad Fort
monuments.description: A massive fort built by Sultan Ghiyas-ud-din Tughlaq in the 14th century, known for its ruins and historical significance.

monuments.name: Lodhi Garden
monuments.description: A city park, it contains several tombs from the Lodhi era, a period of Delhi's history.

monuments.name: Baba Kharak Singh Marg
monuments.description: A memorial and place of significance, with connections to the freedom movement and several landmarks.

monuments.name: Rashtrapati Bhavan
monuments.description: The official residence of the President of India, an architectural masterpiece with beautiful gardens and the Mughal Gardens.

monuments.name: Gurudwara Sis Ganj Sahib
monuments.description: A prominent Gurudwara associated with the martyrdom of Guru Teg Bahadur, the ninth Sikh Guru.

monuments.name: Zafar Mahal
monuments.description: A historical building and the last monumental structure of the Mughal Empire, located in Mehrauli.

monuments.name: Kuthub Minar
monuments.description: An ancient tower built during the Delhi Sultanate, recognized for its towering structure.

monuments.name: Raj Ghat
monuments.description: A memorial to Mahatma Gandhi, marking the site of his cremation, with a simple black marble platform.

monuments.name: Shanti Vana
monuments.description: A memorial dedicated to Jawaharlal Nehru, India's first Prime Minister.

monuments.name: Sarai Kale Khan
monuments.description: An ancient inn located along a major caravan route, now a historical monument.

monuments.name: Chandni Chowk
monuments.description: One of the oldest markets in Delhi, known for its historical significance and vibrant shopping experience.

monuments.name: Indira Gandhi Memorial
monuments.description: A memorial dedicated to India's first female Prime Minister, Indira Gandhi.

monuments.name: Moti Masjid
monuments.description: A mosque built by Emperor Aurangzeb in the 17th century, located near the Red Fort.

monuments.name: National War Memorial
monuments.description: A memorial dedicated to Indian soldiers who died in various conflicts, located near India Gate.

monuments.name: Shahjahanabad
monuments.description: The walled city constructed by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan, now a part of Old Delhi.

monuments.name: Nizamuddin Dargah
monuments.description: The tomb of the famous Sufi saint Nizamuddin Auliya, a significant religious and cultural site.

monuments.name: Agrasen Ki Baoli
monuments.description: A stepwell built by Maharaja Agrasen, located in the heart of New Delhi.

monuments.name: Sultan Ghari Tomb
monuments.description: The tomb of Sultan Iltutmish's son, located in Mehrauli, Delhi.

monuments.name: Feroz Shah Kotla
monuments.description: A fort and a historical monument built by Sultan Feroz Shah Tughlaq, now in ruins.

monuments.name: Mughal Gardens
monuments.description: A collection of beautifully designed gardens reflecting Mughal architectural styles, located near Rashtrapati Bhavan.

monuments.name: Baba Kharak Singh Marg
monuments.description: A historical monument and memorial dedicated to a prominent Sikh personality.

monuments.name: Siri Fort
monuments.description: A historical fort built by Ala-ud-din Khilji during the 14th century.

monuments.name: Delhi Haat
monuments.description: A traditional Indian market and cultural center showcasing Indian handicrafts.

monuments.name: ISKCON Temple
monuments.description: A significant religious temple devoted to Lord Krishna, known for its spiritual teachings and vibrant environment.

monuments.name: Qutub Minar Complex
monuments.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this monument complex includes several historical buildings, mosques, and ruins.

monuments.name: National Zoological Park
monuments.description: A zoo in Delhi featuring a wide variety of animals, a place of historical and educational importance.
